item.title: Abrdn 称，英国散户投资者的股票厌恶情绪阻碍了市场发展
item.description: 根据 Abrdn Plc 的一项分析，在七国集团中，英国储蓄者最不愿意投资股票。【原文：British savers are the most averse to investing in stocks among G7 economies, according to an analysis by Abrdn Plc.】

item.title: 美国制裁与僵尸网络攻击有关的中国网络公司
item.description: 美国财政部制裁了中国网络安全公司 Integrity Technology Group，指控其在国家支持的名为 "Flax Typhoon "的僵尸网络攻击中扮演了重要角色。【原文：The US Treasury Department sanctioned Chinese cybersecurity firm Integrity Technology Group for its alleged role in a state-sponsored botnet attack known as Flax Typhoon.】

item.title: 中国人民银行重申将 "适时 "下调中国利率和存款准备金率
item.description: 在国内和全球经济继续面临挑战的情况下，中国央行重申了 "适时 "降低利率和银行存款准备金率以促进经济增长的承诺。【原文：China’s central bank reiterated its pledge to lower interest rates and the reserve requirement ratio for banks “at an appropriate time” to promote growth, with the economy continuing to face challenges both domestically and globally.】

item.title: 去年底美国制造业指数略有上升
item.description: 随着订单和生产的回升，一项衡量美国工厂活动的指标在 12 月份连续第二个月走高，这表明笼罩在制造业上空的阴云可能开始消散。【原文：A measure of US factory activity advanced for a second month in December as orders and production picked up, suggesting the cloud over manufacturing may be starting to lift.】

item.title: 交易商评估与摩根大通的交易，安哥拉新债券反弹
item.description: 周五，安哥拉国际债券的表现优于大多数新兴市场国家，因为投资者对该国为解决预算缺口和即将到期的债券而进行的最新借贷作出了反应。【原文：Angola’s international bonds outperformed most of their emerging-market peers on Friday as investors reacted to the nation’s latest borrowing to address budget gaps and looming bond maturities.】

item.title: 心灰意冷的以色列人在战争资金紧缩步骤中挣扎
item.description: 更多的税收。可支配收入减少。更高的食品、水电账单。2025 年伊始，以色列人将面临 400 亿谢克尔（110 亿美元）的战争账单，这很可能会加深社会和政治分歧。【原文：More taxes. Less disposable income. Higher food, water and electricity bills. As 2025 starts, Israelis face a 40-billion-shekel ($11-billion) war bill that will likely deepen social and political divides.】

item.title: 奥地利旨在组建三方政府的会谈破裂
item.description: 周五，奥地利中间派政党为阻止右翼民族主义者掌权而组建三方联合政府的努力宣告失败。【原文：Efforts broke down on Friday to form a three-way coalition government among Austria’s centrist parties aimed at blocking right-wing nationalists from taking power.】

item.title: 拜登阻止新日铁斥资 141 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司
item.description: 美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）阻止了美国钢铁公司以 141 亿美元出售给新日本制铁公司（Nippon Steel Corp.【原文：President Joe Biden has blocked the $14.1 billion sale of United States Steel Corp. to Nippon Steel Corp., killing a high-profile deal that sparked a political firestorm and tensions between the US and Japan.】

item.title: 摩尔多瓦地区工业因缺乏俄罗斯天然气而停滞不前
item.description: 据国际文传电讯社（Interfax）报道，在俄罗斯停止通过乌克兰输送天然气后，摩尔多瓦亲莫斯科的分离地区德涅斯特河左岸几乎停止了除食品生产以外的所有工业活动。【原文：Moldova’s pro-Moscow breakaway region of Transnistria halted almost all industrial activity except for food production, following the end of Russian gas flows through Ukraine, Interfax reported.】

item.title: 切尔西俱乐部老板埃格巴里购买价值 5600 万英镑的伦敦顶层公寓
item.description: 切尔西足球俱乐部（Chelsea FC）共同所有人、Clearlake Capital 创始人贝赫达尔-埃格巴利（Behdad Eghbali）以超过 5600 万英镑（约合 7000 万美元）的价格买下了伦敦梅费尔高端区的一栋豪华顶层公寓，成为 2024 年英国最昂贵的公寓交易。【原文：Behdad Eghbali, co-owner of Chelsea FC and founder of Clearlake Capital, bought a luxury penthouse in London’s high-end Mayfair district for more than £56 million ($70 million), making it the UK’s most expensive apartment deal in 2024.】

item.title: 新兴市场货币受特朗普避险情绪影响与黄金走势背离
item.description: 随着投资者为唐纳德-特朗普重返美国总统宝座做准备，黄金和新兴市场货币这两种通常对美元同向波动的资产出现了背离。【原文：Gold and emerging-market currencies — two assets that typically move in the same direction against the dollar — have been diverging as investors prepare for Donald Trump’s return to the US presidency.】

item.title: 什么是英国能源价格上限？
item.description: 英国家庭的能源成本正在上涨，监管机构 Ofgem 提高了允许供应商收费的上限。高昂的能源价格是 2024 年英国大选期间的一大话题。获胜的工党承诺将通过一项从本土可再生能源中获取更多能源的计划来降低账单。这项政策最早也要到 2030 年才能产生重大影响。与此同时，政府正面临着来自立法者、竞选者和业界的呼吁，要求重新审视英国的能源政策。【原文：The cost of energy is rising for UK households, with regulator Ofgem increasing the limit on how much it allows suppliers to charge. High energy prices were a big talking point during the 2024 UK election campaign. The winner, Labour, promised to lower bills with a plan to get more energy from homegrown, renewable sources. That policy is unlikely to have much impact before 2030 at the earliest. Meanwhile, the government is facing calls from lawmakers, campaigners and the industry to review the s】

item.description: 对瑞典食品价格意外高涨的担忧使瑞典央行决策者与该行业最大的游说团体公开交恶。【原文：Concerns over unexpectedly high food prices in Sweden have pulled the Riksbank policymakers into a public feud with the largest lobby group for the sector.】

item.title: 毛里求斯因涉嫌欺诈逮捕前中央银行行长
item.description: 毛里求斯警方逮捕了一名涉嫌共谋诈骗国家的前央行行长，他是纳文钱德拉-拉姆古兰总理领导的新政府对公共财政进行审计后的第一个牺牲品。【原文：Police in Mauritius have arrested the immediate former central bank governor for alleged conspiracy to defraud the nation, the first casualty of an audit of public finances under the new government of Prime Minister Navinchandra Ramgoolam.】

item.title: 泰国在 3.5 亿美元诈骗案中查封大亨资产
item.description: 泰国当局已开始扣押一名医院大亨的资产，该大亨涉嫌从数百名投资者手中骗取超过 120 亿泰铢（约合 3.5 亿美元）的虚假医疗项目资金后逃离泰国。【原文：Thai authorities have begun seizing the assets of a hospital tycoon who fled the country after allegedly luring more than 12 billion baht ($350 million) into fake medical projects from hundreds of investors.】

item.title: 特斯拉在中国上海的年度出货量首次下降
item.description: 特斯拉公司的上海工厂自2020年开始量产以来，年出货量首次出现下降，这是当地竞争加剧和全球需求冷淡的一个明显迹象。【原文：Tesla Inc. recorded its first-ever drop in annual shipments from its Shanghai plant since the facility started mass production in 2020, a clear sign of the intensifying local competition and lukewarm global demand.】

item.title: 瑞银股价上涨，Exane 因可能增加回购而上调评级
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）股价创下两个月来最大涨幅，原因是法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas Exane）的分析师建议买入，预期这家瑞士贷款机构将增加股票回购。【原文：UBS Group AG shares rose the most in two months as analysts at BNP Paribas Exane recommended buying on expectations the Swiss lender will increase share buybacks.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁终止电动汽车税收抵免，推动美国汽车销量年终攀升
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁取消对电动汽车的税收减免，这很可能给插电式汽车在经历了令人失望的一年后带来急需的提振，这也是年底汽车销量大增的一部分。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump’s threat to eliminate tax credits for electric vehicles likely gave plug-in cars a much-needed boost after a disappointing year, part of a broader surge in auto sales at the end of the year.】

item.title: 贸易不确定性将导致食品价格反弹
item.description: 全球食品价格的反弹有可能增加消费者今年的杂货成本，而此时农业世界正在为潜在的贸易混乱做准备。【原文：A rebound in global food prices is threatening to add to consumers’ grocery costs this year, just as the agricultural world braces for potential trade disruptions.】
